event.name: Corporate Event
proTips: Most corporate guests self-limit to 2 drinks max - don't over-order.
Wine outsells beer 3:1 at corporate events - flip your usual ratio.
40% of corporate guests leave within 90 minutes - peak consumption is minutes 15-60.
Weekday events consume 35% less than Friday events.
Always have premium non-alcoholic options prominently displayed.
event.buyingGuide: Focus on quality over quantity for corporate events. Stock premium wines and craft options rather than bulk quantities. Have elegant non-alcoholic options visible - many professionals choose not to drink at work functions. A sophisticated sparkling water with citrus is always appreciated.

meta.title: How Much Beer for 20 Guest Corporate Event? | 3 cases
meta.description: Need beer for a 20-person corporate event? You'll need exactly 3 cases. Free calculator with pro tips from experienced bartenders.
meta.h1: How Much Beer for a 20 Guest Corporate Event?

mathExplanation.label: Estimate actual drinkers
mathExplanation.explanation: At small events, about 80% of guests typically drink alcohol.

mathExplanation.label: Calculate base consumption
mathExplanation.explanation: Industry standard is 1.5 drinks per person per hour for a 3-hour event.

mathExplanation.label: Apply consumption decay
mathExplanation.formula: Adjusted for drinking slowdown over time (decay factor: 2.65)
mathExplanation.explanation: People drink faster in the first hour and slow down as the event progresses.

mathExplanation.label: Apply corporate event modifier
mathExplanation.explanation: Corporate Events typically consume 15% less beer than average.

mathExplanation.label: Convert to cases
mathExplanation.explanation: Each case of beer provides 24 servings.

mathExplanation.label: Add 15% buffer & round up
mathExplanation.explanation: Always round up and add a buffer. Running out is worse than having leftovers!
